ivardefs.name: asserter
ivardefs.desc: Individual or device that is making the condition statement.

ivardefs.name: bodySite_
ivardefs.desc: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

ivardefs.name: category_
ivardefs.desc: A category assigned to the condition.

ivardefs.name: clinicalStatus
ivardefs.desc: The clinical status of the condition.

ivardefs.name: code
ivardefs.desc: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

ivardefs.name: encounter
ivardefs.desc: The Encounter during which this Condition was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

ivardefs.name: evidence_
ivardefs.desc: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.

ivardefs.name: identifier_
ivardefs.desc: Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

ivardefs.name: note_
ivardefs.desc: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry  for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

ivardefs.name: recordedDate
ivardefs.desc: The recordedDate represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

ivardefs.name: recorder
ivardefs.desc: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

ivardefs.name: severity
ivardefs.desc: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

ivardefs.name: stage_
ivardefs.desc: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

ivardefs.name: subject
ivardefs.desc: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

ivardefs.name: verificationStatus
ivardefs.desc: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.

properties.desc: A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.
